title: Master MyHeritage Core Features in Just 5 Minutes
review_html:
Introduction: Master MyHeritage Core Features in Just 5 Minutes

This guide will help you quickly get familiar with the core features of MyHeritage, enabling you to efficiently explore your family history, manage your family tree, and discover fascinating insights about your ancestry.

Prerequisites & Setup

Before diving in, ensure you have the following:

  • A MyHeritage account (sign up at MyHeritage if you don’t have one).
  • A stable internet connection.
  • Basic information about your family (names, birthdates, etc.) to start building your family tree.

Core Step-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Accessing Your Dashboard

Log in to your MyHeritage account and navigate to the main dashboard by clicking on the 'Home' tab.

Step 2: Building Your Family Tree

Click on the 'Family Tree' tab, then select 'Add a Person' to start entering details about your family members.

Step 3: Exploring Historical Records

Go to the 'Search' tab, enter a family member’s name, and click 'Search' to explore historical records and potential matches.

Step 4: Using Smart Matches™

Review Smart Matches™ suggestions under the 'Matches' tab to connect with other users’ family trees and expand your research.

Step 5: Discovering DNA Matches

If you’ve taken a DNA test, visit the 'DNA Matches' tab to explore genetic connections and shared ancestors.

Common Mistakes to Avoid

  • Incomplete Family Information: Ensure you enter as much detail as possible about each family member to get accurate matches.
  • Ignoring Smart Matches™: These can significantly expand your family tree, so review them regularly.
  • Skipping DNA Matches: If you’ve taken a DNA test, checking DNA Matches can reveal unexpected connections.

FAQ

Q: How do I edit a family member’s details?

A: Go to the 'Family Tree' tab, click on the person’s name, and select 'Edit Profile' to update their information.

Q: Can I invite family members to collaborate on the tree?

A: Yes, click on the 'Invite' button in the 'Family Tree' tab and share the invitation link with your family.

Q: How do I save historical records to my tree?

A: When viewing a record, click 'Save to My Tree' and select the relevant family member to attach it.

Q: What if I don’t have much information about my family?

A: Start with what you know, and use Smart Matches™ and historical records to fill in the gaps.

Final Checklist & Key Takeaways

  • Log in to your MyHeritage account.
  • Start building your family tree by adding family members.
  • Explore historical records and Smart Matches™ to expand your research.
  • Review DNA Matches if you’ve taken a DNA test.
  • Regularly update your tree with new information and matches.

By following this guide, you’ll quickly master the core features of MyHeritage and unlock the full potential of your family history research!

Discover more about MyHeritage and start your journey into your family's past today!
